alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 10:30AM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Michigan... North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens affecting Macomb County. For the N.br. Clinton River...including Mt Clemens...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.!. * WHERE...North Branch Clinton near Mt Clemens. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Impact...At 16.0 feet, Some structures will start to be affected. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
